de.iabg.mesh
Class JMeshPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  de.iabg.mesh.JMeshPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Loggable, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class JMeshPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Loggable, Renderable

An implementation of a Finite Element Mesh panel. This component can import geometric data and store the data for later use. Refer to MeshModel class API for more details.

Version:
September 11, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE
See Also:
Serialized Form

fireScene2DChanged

public void fireScene2DChanged(java.lang.Object source)
Description copied from interface: Renderable
Sends a SceneEvent, whose source is this object, to each listener. This method reports that a 2D scene, rather than 3D scene, should be rendered. There may be instances when multiple Renderable objects are aggregated, so a reference of the given source is also sent.

Specified by:
fireScene2DChanged in interface Renderable
Parameters:
source - the object to be rendered in 2D

fireScene3DChanged

public void fireScene3DChanged(java.lang.Object source)
Description copied from interface: Renderable
Sends a SceneEvent, whose source is this object, to each listener. This method reports that a 3D scene, rather than 2D scene, should be rendered. There may be instances when multiple Renderable objects are aggregated, so a reference of the given source is also sent.

Specified by:
fireScene3DChanged in interface Renderable
Parameters:
source - the object to be rendered in 3D

getBoundingRadius2D

public double getBoundingRadius2D()
Description copied from interface: Renderable
Returns the 2D distance of the furthest point from the origin. The 2D distance is calculated from only the x and y coordinates.

Specified by:
getBoundingRadius2D in interface Renderable
Returns:
the 2D distance of the furthest point

getScene2D

public javax.media.j3d.BranchGroup getScene2D(double scale,
                                              javax.vecmath.Color3f backgroundColor)
Description copied from interface: Renderable
Creates a 2D rendering of a Java3D scene that this object represents at the given scale and with the given background color. If there is no scene present, only the background should be created with the given background color.

Specified by:
getScene2D in interface Renderable
Parameters:
scale - the scale of the scene
backgroundColor - the background color of the scene
Returns:
a branch group containing the background and the scene that this object represents

importGeometry

public void importGeometry(java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.io.IOException
Selects the appropriate GeometryReader for the given file and imports all the available geometry contained in the file. This includes the nodes, edges, triangles, and quadrilaterals.

Parameters:
fileName - the file to be imported
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file could not be found
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read

importNodeKeyLists

public void importNodeKeyLists(java.lang.String fileName)
                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                               java.io.IOException
Selects the appropriate KeyReader for the given file and imports all the available groups of node subsets contained in the file.

Parameters:
fileName - the file to be imported
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file could not be found
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read

isConsistent

public boolean isConsistent()
Tests if all the node keys of this JMeshPanel are contained in the stored nodes. If there are no stored nodes or no stored node keys, this method should return true.

Returns:
true if all node keys are contains in the nodes, if there are no stored nodes, or if there are no stored node key; false otherwise

setDefaultKeys

public void setDefaultKeys()
Creates a default node subset group called All Nodes, which is inserted to the node key model. This group should contain all of the currently stored nodes.

setMeshModel

public void setMeshModel(MeshModel meshModel)
Sets the MeshModel that this component represents.

Parameters:

public java.lang.String toString()
